message.content:
cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.PL, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with formal verification of quantitative systems using automata theory. The focus is on a new class of automata called "comparator automata" that read two infinite sequences of weights synchronously and relate their aggregate values. This falls under the category of formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL) and logic in computer science (cs.LO). The paper also discusses algorithms for quantitative graph games with incomplete information, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also deals with limit-average aggregation, which is related to probability and statistics (cs.PL). Finally, the paper discusses winning strategies in games, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT).
